alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Unicoi (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 1:43PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Unicoi, southern Johnson and Carter Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 242 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mountain City to 7 miles south of Hampton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Johnson City, Elizabethton, Erwin, Mountain City, Banner Hill, Hampton, Pine Crest, Unicoi, Roane Mountain State Park and Neva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Unicoi
